question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Solve the inequality $$-13(r+5) + 25 > 4(r-10)$$for $r$. Express your answer in interval notation.
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{(-\infty,-7)}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: First, we use the distributive property to expand the left-hand side of the inequality: $$-13r - 65 + 25 > 4r - 40$$The constants on the left side add up to $-40$, so adding $40$ to both sides cancels all the constant terms: $$-13r > 4r$$Adding $13r$ to both sides yields $$0 > 17r$$and dividing both sides by $17$ gives $0>r$, or in interval notation, $r\in\boxed{(-\infty,0)}$.

ground_truth: First, we use the distributive property to expand the left-hand side of the inequality: $$-13r - 65 + 25 > 4r - 40$$The constants on the left side add up to $-40$, so adding $40$ to both sides cancels all the constant terms: $$-13r > 4r$$Adding $13r$ to both sides yields $$0 > 17r$$and dividing both sides by $17$ gives $0>r$, or in interval notation, $r\in\boxed{(-\infty,0)}$.
